author: Voxren Omega

text: There's a lot of purposely overlapping mechanics, elements and themes for Final Fantasy and you can still identify them as part of the same series. Alundra 2 was a random game they just slapped the name onto. It wasn't a terrible game but highly flawed. I threw it in the trash after I beat it though haha. It was also my first exposure to the series and I almost didn't even give the amazing original game a chance because I feared it would be like this game.
author: xOmniCloudx

text: I've never played the series so I don't know which one's better, but your reasoning doesn't make sense. How could a game be worse just because it has an independent story? And even if it could, wouldn't the first game have the same problem?

text: That's just me, but I could never play this on easy. The harder they hit, the better.
author: Alon Jacovi

text: It's far from perfect though, the graphics are sub-average and the floaty controls make for awkward battles (but surprisingly work well for the platforming). The default camera is too close to the character, make sure to press Select once to zoom it out! I also recommend playing on Easy, which is the equivalentÔªø of Normal in Japan. I'm playing on Normal and the normal monsters hit like a truck! Save states prevent a lot of frustration.
author: SupraDarky

text: I played this Game as a 9 year old kid and i finished it in normal. It was hard. I was stuck like for one year in one dungeon. I played on the original Playstation
author: Antares Blazewar

text: It took me until now to try this game since I heard so many negative things about it. It's true, it has absolutely nothing to do with the first game's story (A New Legend Begins indeed). But you know what? This took me completely by surprise because I find this game very good on its own. The puzzles are super interesting, the music by Tanaka is great as always, the light hearted story is filled with charming humor and the localization by Activision is solid. Full of challenging dungeons.
author: SupraDarky
